column1: 95B84B41-E03F-4DD4-93FC-591B23DD2C20#appfire#21D7C73A-8472-4AED-A514-CFC7B2BF69CC#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 14:45:31.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 14:45:31.0#appfire#1

column1: 97064959-4010-4E60-ABBA-5085FA8410B3#appfire#21D7C73A-8472-4AED-A514-CFC7B2BF69CC#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 14:45:31.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-18 14:45:31.0#appfire#1
